name: Intro
_source: s;Simon;So, we're nearing the grounds of Vesner's castle?
s;Kajal;Yes. He is buried just past here.
s;Simon;His lands have really fallen to ruin, haven't they?
s;Kajal;Lord Vesner was... {w}preocupied{w} late into his life.{w}{br}Defeating death was more important to him than combatting minor bandit gangs.
s;Simon;But look at the state of this place after those "minor gangs" ran rampant.

s;Kajal;Combatting bandits addresses symptoms, not the disease.{w}{br}Recall that the Fates wish for the nobles' downfall, Simon.{w}{br}No amount of "order" created through slaying bandits can change that.
s;Kajal;Wresting control of your fate requires a different kind of strength.{w}{br}The kind of strength Lord Vesner devoted his later life to pursuing.
s;Simon;Look Kajal, you've been helpful so far,{w}{br}but all historical records suggest Vesner was an absent ruler and a lunatic.{w}{br}So I seriously doubt what he could have done.
s;Kajal;Ha, the destiny of those who defy the Fates!{w}{br}To be cast as a villian in Atropos's tapestry, reviled by history.
s;Kajal;Lord Vesner was close to breaking the cycle of the noble houses' collapse.{w}{br}Closer than anyone in history.{w}{br}And for this, he is remembered as "a lunatic," as you put it.
s;Simon;But he still died, didn't he?
speak;Kajal;Not quite. He managed to stay alive in an act of defiance.{w}{br}But perhaps death would have been kinder...
speak;Vincent;Sorry to interrupt, but it looks like we've got company.
speak;Kajal;Bandits? This far into the swamp?{w}{br}They've gotten bolder. Or more foolish.
speak;Simon;We can hold them off.{w}{br}Don't let them reach the entrance to Vesner's lands.
s;Narrator;If the bandits reach the entrance to Vesner's castle grounds, Simon's army will lose.{w}{br}Bandits will prioritize reaching this area.;StyleNid=hint
s;Kajal;Perhaps it's worth investigating those ruins as well...{w}{br}The bandits may have left some things behind.
